storage.name: AccountNonce
documentation: Extrinsics nonce for accounts.

storage.name: ExtrinsicCount
documentation: Total extrinsics count for the current block.

storage.name: AllExtrinsicsWeight
documentation: Total weight for all extrinsics put together, for the current block.

storage.name: AllExtrinsicsLen
documentation: Total length (in bytes) for all extrinsics put together, for the current block.

storage.name: NextWeightMultiplier
documentation: The next weight multiplier. This should be updated at the end of each block based on the
saturation level (weight).

storage.name: BlockHash
documentation: Map of block numbers to block hashes.

storage.name: ExtrinsicData
documentation: Extrinsics data for the current block (maps an extrinsic's index to its data).

storage.name: RandomMaterial
documentation: Series of block headers from the last 81 blocks that acts as random seed material. This is arranged as a
ring buffer with the `i8` prefix being the index into the `Vec` of the oldest hash.

storage.name: Number
documentation: The current block number being processed. Set by `execute_block`.

storage.name: ParentHash
documentation: Hash of the previous block.

storage.name: ExtrinsicsRoot
documentation: Extrinsics root of the current block, also part of the block header.

storage.name: Digest
documentation: Digest of the current block, also part of the block header.

storage.name: Events
documentation: Events deposited for the current block.

storage.name: EventCount
documentation: The number of events in the `Events<T>` list.

storage.name: EventTopics
documentation: Mapping between a topic (represented by T::Hash) and a vector of indexes
of events in the `<Events<T>>` list.
The first key serves no purpose. This field is declared as double_map just
for convenience of using `remove_prefix`.
All topic vectors have deterministic storage locations depending on the topic. This
allows light-clients to leverage the changes trie storage tracking mechanism and
in case of changes fetch the list of events of interest.
The value has the type `(T::BlockNumber, EventIndex)` because if we used only just
the `EventIndex` then in case if the topic has the same contents on the next block
no notification will be triggered thus the event might be lost.

calls.name: remark
documentation: Make some on-chain remark.

calls.name: set_heap_pages
documentation: Set the number of pages in the WebAssembly environment's heap.

calls.name: set_code
documentation: Set the new code.

calls.name: set_storage
documentation: Set some items of storage.

calls.name: kill_storage
documentation: Kill some items from storage.

events.name: ExtrinsicSuccess
documentation: An extrinsic completed successfully.

events.name: ExtrinsicFailed
documentation: An extrinsic failed.

storage.name: LastTimestamp
documentation: The last timestamp.

storage.name: Authorities
documentation: The current authorities

storage.name: Now
documentation: Current time for the current block.

storage.name: DidUpdate
documentation: Did the timestamp get updated in this block?

calls.name: set
documentation: Set the current time.
This call should be invoked exactly once per block. It will panic at the finalization
phase, if this call hasn't been invoked by that time.
The timestamp should be greater than the previous one by the amount specified by
`MinimumPeriod`.
The dispatch origin for this call must be `Inherent`.

constants.name: MinimumPeriod
documentation: The minimum period between blocks. Beware that this is different to the *expected* period
that the block production apparatus provides. Your chosen consensus system will generally
work with this to determine a sensible block time. e.g. For Aura, it will be double this
period on default settings.

storage.name: Uncles
documentation: Uncles

storage.name: Author
documentation: Author of current block.

storage.name: DidSetUncles
documentation: Whether uncles were already set in this block.

calls.name: set_uncles
documentation: Provide a set of uncles.

storage.name: NextEnumSet
documentation: The next free enumeration set.

storage.name: EnumSet
documentation: The enumeration sets.

events.name: NewAccountIndex
documentation: A new account index was assigned.
This event is not triggered when an existing index is reassigned
to another `AccountId`.

storage.name: TotalIssuance
documentation: The total units issued in the system.

storage.name: Vesting
documentation: Information regarding the vesting of a given account.

storage.name: FreeBalance
documentation: The 'free' balance of a given account.
This is the only balance that matters in terms of most operations on tokens. It
alone is used to determine the balance when in the contract execution environment. When this
balance falls below the value of `ExistentialDeposit`, then the 'current account' is
deleted: specifically `FreeBalance`. Further, the `OnFreeBalanceZero` callback
is invoked, giving a chance to external modules to clean up data associated with
the deleted account.
`system::AccountNonce` is also deleted if `ReservedBalance` is also zero (it also gets
collapsed to zero if it ever becomes less than `ExistentialDeposit`.

storage.name: ReservedBalance
documentation: The amount of the balance of a given account that is externally reserved; this can still get
slashed, but gets slashed last of all.
This balance is a 'reserve' balance that other subsystems use in order to set aside tokens
that are still 'owned' by the account holder, but which are suspendable.
When this balance falls below the value of `ExistentialDeposit`, then this 'reserve account'
is deleted: specifically, `ReservedBalance`.
`system::AccountNonce` is also deleted if `FreeBalance` is also zero (it also gets
collapsed to zero if it ever becomes less than `ExistentialDeposit`.)

storage.name: Locks
documentation: Any liquidity locks on some account balances.

calls.name: transfer
documentation: Transfer some liquid free balance to another account.
`transfer` will set the `FreeBalance` of the sender and receiver.
It will decrease the total issuance of the system by the `TransferFee`.
If the sender's account is below the existential deposit as a result
of the transfer, the account will be reaped.
The dispatch origin for this call must be `Signed` by the transactor.
# <weight>
- Dependent on arguments but not critical, given proper implementations for
input config types. See related functions below.
- It contains a limited number of reads and writes internally and no complex computation.
Related functions:
- `ensure_can_withdraw` is always called internally but has a bounded complexity.
- Transferring balances to accounts that did not exist before will cause
`T::OnNewAccount::on_new_account` to be called.
- Removing enough funds from an account will trigger
`T::DustRemoval::on_unbalanced` and `T::OnFreeBalanceZero::on_free_balance_zero`.
# </weight>

calls.name: set_balance
documentation: Set the balances of a given account.
This will alter `FreeBalance` and `ReservedBalance` in storage. it will
also decrease the total issuance of the system (`TotalIssuance`).
If the new free or reserved balance is below the existential deposit,
it will reset the account nonce (`system::AccountNonce`).
The dispatch origin for this call is `root`.
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments.
- Contains a limited number of reads and writes.
# </weight>

events.name: NewAccount
documentation: A new account was created.

events.name: ReapedAccount
documentation: An account was reaped.

events.name: Transfer
documentation: Transfer succeeded (from, to, value, fees).

constants.name: ExistentialDeposit
documentation: The minimum amount required to keep an account open.

constants.name: TransferFee
documentation: The fee required to make a transfer.

constants.name: CreationFee
documentation: The fee required to create an account.

constants.name: TransactionBaseFee
documentation: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the base.

constants.name: TransactionByteFee
documentation: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the per-byte portion.

storage.name: ValidatorCount
documentation: The ideal number of staking participants.

storage.name: MinimumValidatorCount
documentation: Minimum number of staking participants before emergency conditions are imposed.

storage.name: SessionReward
documentation: Maximum reward, per validator, that is provided per acceptable session.

storage.name: OfflineSlash
documentation: Slash, per validator that is taken for the first time they are found to be offline.

storage.name: OfflineSlashGrace
documentation: Number of instances of offline reports before slashing begins for validators.

storage.name: Invulnerables
documentation: Any validators that may never be slashed or forcibly kicked. It's a Vec since they're
easy to initialize and the performance hit is minimal (we expect no more than four
invulnerables) and restricted to testnets.

storage.name: Bonded
documentation: Map from all locked "stash" accounts to the controller account.

storage.name: Ledger
documentation: Map from all (unlocked) "controller" accounts to the info regarding the staking.

storage.name: Payee
documentation: Where the reward payment should be made. Keyed by stash.

storage.name: Validators
documentation: The map from (wannabe) validator stash key to the preferences of that validator.

storage.name: Nominators
documentation: The map from nominator stash key to the set of stash keys of all validators to nominate.

storage.name: Stakers
documentation: Nominators for a particular account that is in action right now. You can't iterate
through validators here, but you can find them in the Session module.
This is keyed by the stash account.

storage.name: CurrentElected
documentation: The currently elected validator set keyed by stash account ID.

storage.name: CurrentEra
documentation: The current era index.

storage.name: CurrentSessionReward
documentation: Maximum reward, per validator, that is provided per acceptable session.

storage.name: CurrentEraReward
documentation: The accumulated reward for the current era. Reset to zero at the beginning of the era
and increased for every successfully finished session.

storage.name: SlotStake
documentation: The amount of balance actively at stake for each validator slot, currently.
This is used to derive rewards and punishments.

storage.name: SlashCount
documentation: The number of times a given validator has been reported offline. This gets decremented
by one each era that passes.

storage.name: RecentlyOffline
documentation: Most recent `RECENT_OFFLINE_COUNT` instances. (Who it was, when it was reported, how
many instances they were offline for).

storage.name: ForceNewEra
documentation: True if the next session change will be a new era regardless of index.

storage.name: BondedEras
documentation: A mapping from still-bonded eras to the first session index of that era.

calls.name: bond
documentation: Take the origin account as a stash and lock up `value` of its balance. `controller` will
be the account that controls it.
`value` must be more than the `existential_deposit` defined in the Balances module.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the stash account.
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments. Moderate complexity.
- Three extra DB entries.
NOTE: Two of the storage writes (`Self::bonded`, `Self::payee`) are _never_ cleaned unless
the `origin` falls below _existential deposit_ and gets removed as dust.
# </weight>

calls.name: bond_extra
documentation: Add some extra amount that have appeared in the stash `free_balance` into the balance up
for staking.
Use this if there are additional funds in your stash account that you wish to bond.
Unlike [`bond`] or [`unbond`] this function does not impose any limitation on the amount
that can be added.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the stash, not the controller.
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments. Insignificant complexity.
- One DB entry.
# </weight>

calls.name: unbond
documentation: Schedule a portion of the stash to be unlocked ready for transfer out after the bond
period ends. If this leaves an amount actively bonded less than
T::Currency::existential_deposit(), then it is increased to the full amount.
Once the unlock period is done, you can call `withdraw_unbonded` to actually move
the funds out of management ready for transfer.
No more than a limited number of unlocking chunks (see `MAX_UNLOCKING_CHUNKS`)
can co-exists at the same time. In that case, [`Call::withdraw_unbonded`] need
to be called first to remove some of the chunks (if possible).
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.
See also [`Call::withdraw_unbonded`].
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments. Limited but potentially exploitable complexity.
- Contains a limited number of reads.
- Each call (requires the remainder of the bonded balance to be above `minimum_balance`)
will cause a new entry to be inserted into a vector (`Ledger.unlocking`) kept in storage.
The only way to clean the aforementioned storage item is also user-controlled via `withdraw_unbonded`.
- One DB entry.
</weight>

calls.name: withdraw_unbonded
documentation: Remove any unlocked chunks from the `unlocking` queue from our management.
This essentially frees up that balance to be used by the stash account to do
whatever it wants.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.
See also [`Call::unbond`].
# <weight>
- Could be dependent on the `origin` argument and how much `unlocking` chunks exist.
It implies `consolidate_unlocked` which loops over `Ledger.unlocking`, which is
indirectly user-controlled. See [`unbond`] for more detail.
- Contains a limited number of reads, yet the size of which could be large based on `ledger`.
- Writes are limited to the `origin` account key.
# </weight>

calls.name: validate
documentation: Declare the desire to validate for the origin controller.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments. Insignificant complexity.
- Contains a limited number of reads.
- Writes are limited to the `origin` account key.
# </weight>

calls.name: nominate
documentation: Declare the desire to nominate `targets` for the origin controller.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.
# <weight>
- The transaction's complexity is proportional to the size of `targets`,
which is capped at `MAX_NOMINATIONS`.
- Both the reads and writes follow a similar pattern.
# </weight>

calls.name: chill
documentation: Declare no desire to either validate or nominate.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments. Insignificant complexity.
- Contains one read.
- Writes are limited to the `origin` account key.
# </weight>

calls.name: set_payee
documentation: (Re-)set the payment target for a controller.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the controller, not the stash.
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments. Insignificant complexity.
- Contains a limited number of reads.
- Writes are limited to the `origin` account key.
# </weight>

calls.name: set_controller
documentation: (Re-)set the payment target for a controller.
Effects will be felt at the beginning of the next era.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_ by the stash, not the controller.
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments. Insignificant complexity.
- Contains a limited number of reads.
- Writes are limited to the `origin` account key.
# </weight>

calls.name: set_validator_count
documentation: The ideal number of validators.

calls.name: force_new_era
documentation: Force there to be a new era. This also forces a new session immediately after.
`apply_rewards` should be true for validators to get the session reward.
# <weight>
- Independent of the arguments.
- Triggers the Phragmen election. Expensive but not user-controlled.
- Depends on state: `O(|edges| * |validators|)`.
# </weight>

calls.name: set_offline_slash_grace
documentation: Set the offline slash grace period.

calls.name: set_invulnerables
documentation: Set the validators who cannot be slashed (if any).

events.name: Reward
documentation: All validators have been rewarded by the given balance.

events.name: OfflineWarning
documentation: One validator (and its nominators) has been given an offline-warning (it is still
within its grace). The accrued number of slashes is recorded, too.

events.name: OfflineSlash
documentation: One validator (and its nominators) has been slashed by the given amount.

constants.name: SessionsPerEra
documentation: Number of sessions per era.

constants.name: BondingDuration
documentation: Number of eras that staked funds must remain bonded for.

storage.name: Validators
documentation: The current set of validators.

storage.name: CurrentIndex
documentation: Current index of the session.

storage.name: Changed
documentation: True if anything has changed in this session.

storage.name: QueuedChanged
documentation: Queued keys changed.

storage.name: QueuedKeys
documentation: The queued keys for the next session. When the next session begins, these keys
will be used to determine the validator's session keys.

storage.name: NextKeys
documentation: The next session keys for a validator.
The first key is always `DEDUP_KEY_PREFIX` to have all the data in the same branch of
the trie. Having all data in the same branch should prevent slowing down other queries.

storage.name: KeyOwner
documentation: The owner of a key. The second key is the `KeyTypeId` + the encoded key.
The first key is always `DEDUP_KEY_PREFIX` to have all the data in the same branch of
the trie. Having all data in the same branch should prevent slowing down other queries.

calls.name: set_keys
documentation: Sets the session key(s) of the function caller to `key`.
Allows an account to set its session key prior to becoming a validator.
This doesn't take effect until the next session.
The dispatch origin of this function must be signed.
# <weight>
- O(log n) in number of accounts.
- One extra DB entry.
# </weight>

events.name: NewSession
documentation: New session has happened. Note that the argument is the session index, not the block
number as the type might suggest.

constants.name: DEDUP_KEY_PREFIX
documentation: Used as first key for `NextKeys` and `KeyOwner` to put all the data into the same branch
of the trie.

storage.name: PublicPropCount
documentation: The number of (public) proposals that have been made so far.

storage.name: PublicProps
documentation: The public proposals. Unsorted.

storage.name: DepositOf
documentation: Those who have locked a deposit.

storage.name: ReferendumCount
documentation: The next free referendum index, aka the number of referenda started so far.

storage.name: NextTally
documentation: The next referendum index that should be tallied.

storage.name: ReferendumInfoOf
documentation: Information concerning any given referendum.

storage.name: DispatchQueue
documentation: Queue of successful referenda to be dispatched.

storage.name: VotersFor
documentation: Get the voters for the current proposal.

storage.name: VoteOf
documentation: Get the vote in a given referendum of a particular voter. The result is meaningful only
if `voters_for` includes the voter when called with the referendum (you'll get the
default `Vote` value otherwise). If you don't want to check `voters_for`, then you can
also check for simple existence with `VoteOf::exists` first.

storage.name: Proxy
documentation: Who is able to vote for whom. Value is the fund-holding account, key is the
vote-transaction-sending account.

storage.name: Delegations
documentation: Get the account (and lock periods) to which another account is delegating vote.

storage.name: LastTabledWasExternal
documentation: True if the last referendum tabled was submitted externally. False if it was a public
proposal.

storage.name: NextExternal
documentation: The referendum to be tabled whenever it would be valid to table an external proposal.
This happens when a referendum needs to be tabled and one of two conditions are met:
- `LastTabledWasExternal` is `false`; or
- `PublicProps` is empty.

storage.name: Blacklist
documentation: A record of who vetoed what. Maps proposal hash to a possible existent block number
(until when it may not be resubmitted) and who vetoed it.

storage.name: Cancellations
documentation: Record of all proposals that have been subject to emergency cancellation.

calls.name: propose
documentation: Propose a sensitive action to be taken.
# <weight>
- Two DB changes, one DB entry.
# </weight>

calls.name: second
documentation: Propose a sensitive action to be taken.
# <weight>
- One DB entry.
# </weight>

calls.name: vote
documentation: Vote in a referendum. If `vote.is_aye()`, the vote is to enact the proposal;
otherwise it is a vote to keep the status quo.
# <weight>
- One DB change, one DB entry.
# </weight>

calls.name: proxy_vote
documentation: Vote in a referendum on behalf of a stash. If `vote.is_aye()`, the vote is to enact
the proposal;  otherwise it is a vote to keep the status quo.
# <weight>
- One DB change, one DB entry.
# </weight>

calls.name: emergency_propose
documentation: Schedule an emergency referendum.
This will create a new referendum for the `proposal`, approved as long as counted votes
exceed `threshold` and, if approved, enacted after the given `delay`.
It may be called from either the Root or the Emergency origin.

calls.name: emergency_cancel
documentation: Schedule an emergency cancellation of a referendum. Cannot happen twice to the same
referendum.

calls.name: external_propose
documentation: Schedule a referendum to be tabled once it is legal to schedule an external
referendum.

calls.name: external_propose_majority
documentation: Schedule a majority-carries referendum to be tabled next once it is legal to schedule
an external referendum.

calls.name: external_push
documentation: Schedule the currently externally-proposed majority-carries referendum to be tabled
immediately. If there is no externally-proposed referendum currently, or if there is one
but it is not a majority-carries referendum then it fails.
- `proposal_hash`: The hash of the current external proposal.
- `voting_period`: The period that is allowed for voting on this proposal.
- `delay`: The number of block after voting has ended in approval and this should be
enacted. Increased to `EmergencyVotingPeriod` if too low.

calls.name: veto_external
documentation: Veto and blacklist the external proposal hash.

calls.name: cancel_referendum
documentation: Remove a referendum.

calls.name: cancel_queued
documentation: Cancel a proposal queued for enactment.

calls.name: set_proxy
documentation: Specify a proxy. Called by the stash.
# <weight>
- One extra DB entry.
# </weight>

calls.name: resign_proxy
documentation: Clear the proxy. Called by the proxy.
# <weight>
- One DB clear.
# </weight>

calls.name: remove_proxy
documentation: Clear the proxy. Called by the stash.
# <weight>
- One DB clear.
# </weight>

calls.name: delegate
documentation: Delegate vote.
# <weight>
- One extra DB entry.
# </weight>

calls.name: undelegate
documentation: Undelegate vote.
# <weight>
# </weight>

constants.name: EnactmentPeriod
documentation: The minimum period of locking and the period between a proposal being approved and enacted.
It should generally be a little more than the unstake period to ensure that
voting stakers have an opportunity to remove themselves from the system in the case where
they are on the losing side of a vote.

constants.name: LaunchPeriod
documentation: How often (in blocks) new public referenda are launched.

constants.name: VotingPeriod
documentation: How often (in blocks) to check for new votes.

constants.name: MinimumDeposit
documentation: The minimum amount to be used as a deposit for a public referendum proposal.

constants.name: EmergencyVotingPeriod
documentation: Minimum voting period allowed for an emergency referendum.

constants.name: CooloffPeriod
documentation: Period in blocks where an external proposal may not be re-submitted after being vetoed.

storage.name: Proposals
documentation: The hashes of the active proposals.

storage.name: ProposalOf
documentation: Actual proposal for a given hash, if it's current.

storage.name: Voting
documentation: Votes on a given proposal, if it is ongoing.

storage.name: ProposalCount
documentation: Proposals so far.

storage.name: Members
documentation: The current members of the collective. This is stored sorted (just by value).

calls.name: set_members
documentation: Set the collective's membership manually to `new_members`. Be nice to the chain and
provide it pre-sorted.
Requires root origin.

calls.name: execute
documentation: Dispatch a proposal from a member using the `Member` origin.
Origin must be a member of the collective.

calls.name: propose
documentation: # <weight>
- Bounded storage reads and writes.
- Argument `threshold` has bearing on weight.
# </weight>

calls.name: vote
documentation: # <weight>
- Bounded storage read and writes.
- Will be slightly heavier if the proposal is approved / disapproved after the vote.
# </weight>

events.name: Proposed
documentation: A motion (given hash) has been proposed (by given account) with a threshold (given
`MemberCount`).

events.name: Voted
documentation: A motion (given hash) has been voted on by given account, leaving
a tally (yes votes and no votes given respectively as `MemberCount`).

events.name: Approved
documentation: A motion was approved by the required threshold.

events.name: Disapproved
documentation: A motion was not approved by the required threshold.

events.name: Executed
documentation: A motion was executed; `bool` is true if returned without error.

events.name: MemberExecuted
documentation: A single member did some action; `bool` is true if returned without error.

storage.name: Proposals
documentation: The hashes of the active proposals.

storage.name: ProposalOf
documentation: Actual proposal for a given hash, if it's current.

storage.name: Voting
documentation: Votes on a given proposal, if it is ongoing.

storage.name: ProposalCount
documentation: Proposals so far.

storage.name: Members
documentation: The current members of the collective. This is stored sorted (just by value).

calls.name: set_members
documentation: Set the collective's membership manually to `new_members`. Be nice to the chain and
provide it pre-sorted.
Requires root origin.

calls.name: execute
documentation: Dispatch a proposal from a member using the `Member` origin.
Origin must be a member of the collective.

calls.name: propose
documentation: # <weight>
- Bounded storage reads and writes.
- Argument `threshold` has bearing on weight.
# </weight>

calls.name: vote
documentation: # <weight>
- Bounded storage read and writes.
- Will be slightly heavier if the proposal is approved / disapproved after the vote.
# </weight>

events.name: Proposed
documentation: A motion (given hash) has been proposed (by given account) with a threshold (given
`MemberCount`).

events.name: Voted
documentation: A motion (given hash) has been voted on by given account, leaving
a tally (yes votes and no votes given respectively as `MemberCount`).

events.name: Approved
documentation: A motion was approved by the required threshold.

events.name: Disapproved
documentation: A motion was not approved by the required threshold.

events.name: Executed
documentation: A motion was executed; `bool` is true if returned without error.

events.name: MemberExecuted
documentation: A single member did some action; `bool` is true if returned without error.

storage.name: PresentationDuration
documentation: How long to give each top candidate to present themselves after the vote ends.

storage.name: TermDuration
documentation: How long each position is active for.

storage.name: DesiredSeats
documentation: Number of accounts that should constitute the collective.

storage.name: Members
documentation: The current membership. When there's a vote going on, this should still be used for executive
matters. The block number (second element in the tuple) is the block that their position is
active until (calculated by the sum of the block number when the member was elected
and their term duration).

storage.name: VoteCount
documentation: The total number of vote rounds that have happened or are in progress.

storage.name: ApprovalsOf
documentation: A list of votes for each voter. The votes are stored as numeric values and parsed in a bit-wise manner.
In order to get a human-readable representation (`Vec<bool>`), use [`all_approvals_of`].
Furthermore, each vector of scalars is chunked with the cap of `APPROVAL_SET_SIZE`.

storage.name: RegisterInfoOf
documentation: The vote index and list slot that the candidate `who` was registered or `None` if they are not
currently registered.

storage.name: VoterInfoOf
documentation: Basic information about a voter.

storage.name: Voters
documentation: The present voter list (chunked and capped at [`VOTER_SET_SIZE`]).

storage.name: NextVoterSet
documentation: the next free set to store a voter in. This will keep growing.

storage.name: VoterCount
documentation: Current number of Voters.

storage.name: Candidates
documentation: The present candidate list.

storage.name: CandidateCount
documentation: Current number of active candidates

storage.name: NextFinalize
documentation: The accounts holding the seats that will become free on the next tally.

storage.name: Leaderboard
documentation: Get the leaderboard if we're in the presentation phase. The first element is the weight of each entry;
It may be the direct summed approval stakes, or a weighted version of it.

storage.name: Proxy
documentation: Who is able to vote for whom. Value is the fund-holding account, key is the
vote-transaction-sending account.

calls.name: set_approvals
documentation: Set candidate approvals. Approval slots stay valid as long as candidates in those slots
are registered.
Locks the total balance of caller indefinitely.
Only [`retract_voter`] or [`reap_inactive_voter`] can unlock the balance.
`hint` argument is interpreted differently based on:
- if `origin` is setting approvals for the first time: The index will be checked
for being a valid _hole_ in the voter list.
- if the hint is correctly pointing to a hole, no fee is deducted from `origin`.
- Otherwise, the call will succeed but the index is ignored and simply a push to the last chunk
with free space happens. If the new push causes a new chunk to be created, a fee indicated by
[`VotingFee`] is deducted.
- if `origin` is already a voter: the index __must__ be valid and point to the correct
position of the `origin` in the current voters list.
Note that any trailing `false` votes in `votes` is ignored; In approval voting, not voting for a candidate
and voting false, are equal.
# <weight>
- Two extra DB entries, one DB change.
- Argument `votes` is limited in length to number of candidates.
# </weight>

calls.name: proxy_set_approvals
documentation: Set candidate approvals from a proxy. Approval slots stay valid as long as candidates in those slots
are registered.
# <weight>
- Same as `set_approvals` with one additional storage read.
# </weight>

calls.name: reap_inactive_voter
documentation: Remove a voter. For it not to be a bond-consuming no-op, all approved candidate indices
must now be either unregistered or registered to a candidate that registered the slot after
the voter gave their last approval set.
Both indices must be provided as explained in [`voter_at`] function.
May be called by anyone. Returns the voter deposit to `signed`.
# <weight>
- Two fewer DB entries, one DB change.
# </weight>

calls.name: retract_voter
documentation: Remove a voter. All votes are cancelled and the voter deposit is returned.
The index must be provided as explained in [`voter_at`] function.
Also removes the lock on the balance of the voter. See [`do_set_approvals()`].
# <weight>
- Two fewer DB entries, one DB change.
# </weight>

calls.name: submit_candidacy
documentation: Submit oneself for candidacy.
Account must have enough transferrable funds in it to pay the bond.
NOTE: if `origin` has already assigned approvals via [`set_approvals`],
it will NOT have any usable funds to pass candidacy bond and must first retract.
Note that setting approvals will lock the entire balance of the voter until
retraction or being reported.
# <weight>
- Independent of input.
- Three DB changes.
# </weight>

calls.name: present_winner
documentation: Claim that `signed` is one of the top Self::carry_count() + current_vote().1 candidates.
Only works if the `block_number >= current_vote().0` and `< current_vote().0 + presentation_duration()`
`signed` should have at least
# <weight>
- O(voters) compute.
- One DB change.
# </weight>

calls.name: set_desired_seats
documentation: Set the desired member count; if lower than the current count, then seats will not be up
election when they expire. If more, then a new vote will be started if one is not
already in progress.

calls.name: remove_member
documentation: Remove a particular member from the set. This is effective immediately.
Note: A tally should happen instantly (if not already in a presentation
period) to fill the seat if removal means that the desired members are not met.

calls.name: set_presentation_duration
documentation: Set the presentation duration. If there is currently a vote being presented for, will
invoke `finalize_vote`.

calls.name: set_term_duration
documentation: Set the presentation duration. If there is current a vote being presented for, will
invoke `finalize_vote`.

events.name: VoterReaped
documentation: reaped voter, reaper

events.name: BadReaperSlashed
documentation: slashed reaper

events.name: TallyStarted
documentation: A tally (for approval votes of seat(s)) has started.

events.name: TallyFinalized
documentation: A tally (for approval votes of seat(s)) has ended (with one or more new members).

constants.name: CandidacyBond
documentation: How much should be locked up in order to submit one's candidacy. A reasonable
default value is 9.

constants.name: VotingBond
documentation: How much should be locked up in order to be able to submit votes.

constants.name: VotingFee
documentation: The amount of fee paid upon each vote submission, unless if they submit a
_hole_ index and replace it.

constants.name: PresentSlashPerVoter
documentation: The punishment, per voter, if you provide an invalid presentation. A
reasonable default value is 1.

constants.name: CarryCount
documentation: How many runners-up should have their approvals persist until the next
vote. A reasonable default value is 2.

constants.name: InactiveGracePeriod
documentation: How many vote indices need to go by after a target voter's last vote before
they can be reaped if their approvals are moot. A reasonable default value
is 1.

constants.name: VotingPeriod
documentation: How often (in blocks) to check for new votes. A reasonable default value

constants.name: DecayRatio
documentation: Decay factor of weight when being accumulated. It should typically be set to
__at least__ `membership_size -1` to keep the collective secure.
When set to `N`, it indicates `(1/N)^t` of staked is decayed at weight
increment step `t`. 0 will result in no weight being added at all (normal
approval voting). A reasonable default value is 24.

constants.name: VOTER_SET_SIZE
documentation: The chunk size of the voter vector.

constants.name: APPROVAL_SET_SIZE
documentation: The chunk size of the approval vector.

calls.name: final_hint
documentation: Hint that the author of this block thinks the best finalized
block is the given number.

constants.name: WindowSize
documentation: The number of recent samples to keep from this chain. Default is 101.

constants.name: ReportLatency
documentation: The delay after which point things become suspicious. Default is 1000.

storage.name: Authorities
documentation: The current authority set.

storage.name: State
documentation: State of the current authority set.

storage.name: PendingChange
documentation: Pending change: (signaled at, scheduled change).

storage.name: NextForced
documentation: next block number where we can force a change.

storage.name: Stalled
documentation: `true` if we are currently stalled.

calls.name: report_misbehavior
documentation: Report some misbehavior.

events.name: NewAuthorities
documentation: New authority set has been applied.

events.name: Paused
documentation: Current authority set has been paused.

events.name: Resumed
documentation: Current authority set has been resumed.

storage.name: ProposalCount
documentation: Number of proposals that have been made.

storage.name: Proposals
documentation: Proposals that have been made.

storage.name: Approvals
documentation: Proposal indices that have been approved but not yet awarded.

calls.name: propose_spend
documentation: Put forward a suggestion for spending. A deposit proportional to the value
is reserved and slashed if the proposal is rejected. It is returned once the
proposal is awarded.
# <weight>
- Limited storage reads.
- One DB change, one extra DB entry.
# </weight>

calls.name: reject_proposal
documentation: Reject a proposed spend. The original deposit will be slashed.
# <weight>
- Limited storage reads.
- One DB clear.
# </weight>

calls.name: approve_proposal
documentation: Approve a proposal. At a later time, the proposal will be allocated to the beneficiary
and the original deposit will be returned.
# <weight>
- Limited storage reads.
- One DB change.
# </weight>

events.name: Proposed
documentation: New proposal.

events.name: Spending
documentation: We have ended a spend period and will now allocate funds.

events.name: Awarded
documentation: Some funds have been allocated.

events.name: Burnt
documentation: Some of our funds have been burnt.

events.name: Rollover
documentation: Spending has finished; this is the amount that rolls over until next spend.

constants.name: ProposalBond
documentation: Fraction of a proposal's value that should be bonded in order to place the proposal.
An accepted proposal gets these back. A rejected proposal does not.

constants.name: ProposalBondMinimum
documentation: Minimum amount of funds that should be placed in a deposit for making a proposal.

constants.name: SpendPeriod
documentation: Period between successive spends.

constants.name: Burn
documentation: Percentage of spare funds (if any) that are burnt per spend period.

storage.name: GasSpent
documentation: Gas spent so far in this block.

storage.name: CurrentSchedule
documentation: Current cost schedule for contracts.

storage.name: PristineCode
documentation: A mapping from an original code hash to the original code, untouched by instrumentation.

storage.name: CodeStorage
documentation: A mapping between an original code hash and instrumented wasm code, ready for execution.

storage.name: AccountCounter
documentation: The subtrie counter.

storage.name: ContractInfoOf
documentation: The code associated with a given account.

storage.name: GasPrice
documentation: The price of one unit of gas.

calls.name: update_schedule
documentation: Updates the schedule for metering contracts.
The schedule must have a greater version than the stored schedule.

calls.name: put_code
documentation: Stores the given binary Wasm code into the chain's storage and returns its `codehash`.
You can instantiate contracts only with stored code.

calls.name: call
documentation: Makes a call to an account, optionally transferring some balance.
* If the account is a smart-contract account, the associated code will be
executed and any value will be transferred.
* If the account is a regular account, any value will be transferred.
* If no account exists and the call value is not less than `existential_deposit`,
a regular account will be created and any value will be transferred.

calls.name: create
documentation: Creates a new contract from the `codehash` generated by `put_code`, optionally transferring some balance.
Creation is executed as follows:
- The destination address is computed based on the sender and hash of the code.
- The smart-contract account is created at the computed address.
- The `ctor_code` is executed in the context of the newly-created account. Buffer returned
after the execution is saved as the `code` of the account. That code will be invoked
upon any call received by this account.
- The contract is initialized.

calls.name: claim_surcharge
documentation: Allows block producers to claim a small reward for evicting a contract. If a block producer
fails to do so, a regular users will be allowed to claim the reward.
If contract is not evicted as a result of this call, no actions are taken and
the sender is not eligible for the reward.

calls.name: restore_to
documentation: Allows a contract to restore a tombstone by giving its storage.
The contract that wants to restore (i.e. origin of the call, or `msg.sender` in Solidity terms) will compute a
tombstone with its storage and the given code_hash. If the computed tombstone
match the destination one, the destination contract is restored with the rent_allowance` specified,
while the origin sends all its funds to the destination and is removed.

events.name: Transfer
documentation: Transfer happened `from` to `to` with given `value` as part of a `call` or `create`.

events.name: Instantiated
documentation: Contract deployed by address at the specified address.

events.name: CodeStored
documentation: Code with the specified hash has been stored.

events.name: ScheduleUpdated
documentation: Triggered when the current schedule is updated.

events.name: Dispatched
documentation: A call was dispatched from the given account. The bool signals whether it was
successful execution or not.

events.name: Contract
documentation: An event from contract of account.

constants.name: SignedClaimHandicap
documentation: Number of block delay an extrinsic claim surcharge has.
When claim surcharge is called by an extrinsic the rent is checked
for current_block - delay

constants.name: TombstoneDeposit
documentation: The minimum amount required to generate a tombstone.

constants.name: StorageSizeOffset
documentation: Size of a contract at the time of creation. This is a simple way to ensure
that empty contracts eventually gets deleted.

constants.name: RentByteFee
documentation: Price of a byte of storage per one block interval. Should be greater than 0.

constants.name: RentDepositOffset
documentation: The amount of funds a contract should deposit in order to offset
the cost of one byte.
Let's suppose the deposit is 1,000 BU (balance units)/byte and the rent is 1 BU/byte/day,
then a contract with 1,000,000 BU that uses 1,000 bytes of storage would pay no rent.
But if the balance reduced to 500,000 BU and the storage stayed the same at 1,000,
then it would pay 500 BU/day.

constants.name: SurchargeReward
documentation: Reward that is received by the party whose touch has led
to removal of a contract.

constants.name: TransferFee
documentation: The fee required to make a transfer.

constants.name: CreationFee
documentation: The fee required to create an account.

constants.name: TransactionBaseFee
documentation: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the base.

constants.name: TransactionByteFee
documentation: The fee to be paid for making a transaction; the per-byte portion.

constants.name: ContractFee
documentation: The fee required to create a contract instance. A reasonable default value
is 21.

constants.name: CallBaseFee
documentation: The base fee charged for calling into a contract. A reasonable default
value is 135.

constants.name: CreateBaseFee
documentation: The base fee charged for creating a contract. A reasonable default value

constants.name: MaxDepth
documentation: The maximum nesting level of a call/create stack. A reasonable default
value is 100.

constants.name: MaxValueSize
documentation: The maximum size of a storage value in bytes. A reasonable default is 16 KiB.

constants.name: BlockGasLimit
documentation: The maximum amount of gas that could be expended per block. A reasonable
default value is 10_000_000.

storage.name: Key
documentation: The `AccountId` of the sudo key.

calls.name: sudo
documentation: Authenticates the sudo key and dispatches a function call with `Root` origin.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_.
# <weight>
- Limited storage reads.
- No DB writes.
# </weight>

calls.name: set_key
documentation: Authenticates the current sudo key and sets the given AccountId (`new`) as the new sudo key.
The dispatch origin for this call must be _Signed_.
# <weight>
- Limited storage reads.
- One DB change.
# </weight>

events.name: Sudid
documentation: A sudo just took place.

events.name: KeyChanged
documentation: The sudoer just switched identity; the old key is supplied.

events.name: HeartbeatReceived
documentation: A new heartbeat was received at this `BlockNumber` from `AuthorityId`

constants.name: SessionsPerEra
documentation: Number of sessions per era.
